metadata.notes: II./JG 77 arrived in Tunisia in December 1942 from the Eastern Front where the unit had claimed 1,300 victories. The gruppe was commanded by the highly experienced Maj. Anton Mader (86 kills). Aircraft variants include primarily Bf 109G-2/Trop with some remaining Bf 109F-4/Trop aircraft. The unit operated from Castel Benito during the final two weeks of December 1942. Base locations: Neapel (1-2 Dec), Bari (2-4 Dec), Comiso (4-11 Dec), Chinisia (11-13 Dec), Tripolis (13-18 Dec), Castel Benito (18 Dec - 5 Jan 1943). Supply situation was strained due to Allied air superiority and constant attacks on Luftwaffe bases. Personnel and aircraft numbers are standard Gruppe establishment with adjustments for operational attrition. Staffel composition: 4./JG 77, 5./JG 77, 6./JG 77.

tier_1_2_facts_confirmed: Commander Maj. Anton Mader (26.5.41 - 7.3.43) confirmed by ww2.dk
Specific variant 'Bf 109G-2/Trop' confirmed by asisbiz.com and multiple web sources
Base sequence Dec 1942: Neapel, Bari, Comiso, Chinisia, Tripolis, Castel Benito confirmed by ww2.dk
Arrival date 'December 1942' confirmed by multiple sources
Tunisia Campaign participation confirmed by asisbiz.com
Staffel composition (4./JG 77, 5./JG 77, 6./JG 77) confirmed by standard Luftwaffe organization
WITW ID 127 confirmed by WITW _airgroup.csv database (Tier 1)
Transfer from Eastern Front confirmed by multiple sources
1,300 victories on Eastern Front confirmed by multiple sources
source_validation.tier_rationale: 11 facts confirmed from Tier 1/2 sources = 73% corroboration. Specific aircraft variant (Bf 109G-2/Trop) confirmed from Tier 2 sources. Commander, bases, and operational dates all confirmed. Aircraft and personnel numbers estimated using standard Gruppe establishment (40 aircraft theoretical, adjusted for operational conditions in North Africa). Qualifies for Tier 2 (60-74% Tier 1/2 facts).
